title.narrative: LEARNING AND SKILLS

description.narrative: By 2021, education policy makers have increased capacity to develop and implement a competency-based curriculum, incorporating foundational and transferable skills and to monitor learning outcome including for disadvantage children such as migrant, ethnic minorities., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Education In Emergencies, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security and other lines ministries have enhanced capacity to effectively implement and monitor the provision of child-sensitive social protection for children (e.g. child support grant, disability grant, grant for poor students and others)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, education policy makers have increased capacity to develop and implement a competency-based curriculum, incorporatingfoundational and transferable skills and to monitor learning outcome including for disadvantage children such as migrant, ethnicminorities.

description.narrative: In 2021, 95 per cent of schools nationwide re-opened building on successful advocacy on school safety and prioritization of vaccination of teachers. The Skills and Competency-based curriculum was revised and launched in October. Over 75,000 school children (51 per cent girls) in the country engaged in the “Every Child Can Read” initiative. Evidence was generated on the impact of COVID-19 onthe functioning of education systems, including partnering on the annualEducation Situation Analysis and stemmed from the facilitation of global and regional knowledge exchange on lessons learned, the latter engaged over 40,000 participants online | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022
